item.title: Demo Showcase: Blade Runner Meets VR in L.A.2097: Precipice
item.description:
Demo Showcase: Blade Runner Meets VR in L.A.2097: Precipice

Stand on Deckard's balcony on a rainy night with this artful, Blade Runner inspired Virtual Reality demo by first-time VR developer zx81

item.title: The HTC Vive May be Heading for a Soft Launch
item.description:
The HTC Vive May be Heading for a Soft Launch

by Augmentl (@augmentl), January 19 2016.

item.title: This Situation is Copyrighted: When Cinematic Set Pieces Meet Virtual Reality
item.description:
This Situation is Copyrighted: When Cinematic Set Pieces Meet Virtual Reality

Suddenly, a large rotating blade scythes through a groove in the wall, heading towards you. You don't duck fast enough. You experience your head roll to the ground just before your world fades to black. The level reloads.

item.title: HTC Denies Reports It Will Spin Its VR Business Into A Standalone Company
item.description:
HTC Denies Reports It Will Spin Its VR Business Into A Standalone Company

Virtual reality is becoming a major focus for struggling smartphone maker HTC, but not so major that it will spin out its VR business into a standalone company. The firm today issued a statement denying a report from local media in its home country of Taiwan which claimed Chairwoman Cher Wang is in the process of creating a new VR entity that is wholly owned by her and HTC.

item.title: Facebook is opening an Oculus research office in Pittsburgh
item.description:
Facebook is opening an Oculus research office in Pittsburgh

Facebook is opening an office focused on research for its Oculus virtual reality platform in Pittsburgh, of all places. An Oculus spokeswoman confirmed that the company has leased an office in Pittsburgh "that's dedicated to Oculus Research." In other words, it's not just for any employees of Facebook, and not just for any Oculus employees, either.

item.title: Report: HTC to spin-off Vive VR in to independent company
item.description:
Report: HTC to spin-off Vive VR in to independent company

A report from Focus Taiwan this morning claims that HTC is seriously considering, even planning, to spin-off its virtual reality efforts in to a separate independent company. If HTC goes ahead with the plans, it could mean we'll eventually start seeing headsets like the Vive launch without HTC's branding on them...

item.title: Google's Cardboard Isn't Really VR, But It's About to Get a Whole Lot Closer to the Real Thing
item.description:
Google's Cardboard Isn't Really VR, But It's About to Get a Whole Lot Closer to the Real Thing

For all there is to love about Google Cardboard, it's still a bare-bones experience. It's barely even VR, really. But the cheap, smartphone-based viewer offers the VR-curious an easy window into 360-degree video. Pricier headsets like the Oculus Rift and Sony PlayStation VR, designed for gaming, deliver more than a cool stereoscopic viewing experience.

item.title: The inside story of Lucky's Tale, the Super Mario of virtual reality
item.description:
The inside story of Lucky's Tale, the Super Mario of virtual reality

You may not have yet heard of Lucky's Tale, but if you're going to be testing the waters of virtual reality anytime soon, there's a good chance you will. We sat down with the mastermind behind VR's answer to Super Mario Bros., to talk about the making of the Rift launch title, the challenges that went along with it and the potential parallels between early VR and early Walt Disney.

item.title: 8 Highlights From an AMA With Oculus Founder Palmer Luckey
item.description:
8 Highlights From an AMA With Oculus Founder Palmer Luckey

From Rift production issues to the future of the Oculus Store, here are some key highlights from yesterday's Reddit AMA.

item.title: Preorders for the HTC Vive open February 29, But Can HTC Deliver by April?
item.description:
Preorders for the HTC Vive open February 29, But Can HTC Deliver by April?

Aside from the price, the big question that remains concerning the Vive is whether HTC's promised April timeframe for shipping and wider consumer availability is realistic. While Oculus announced the start of production and manufacturing of their consumer product as far back as September 2015, HTC are yet to show a final, consumer ready version of their VR offering.
